nodes.bodyText: @abhimanyugupta07  does this seem correct to you?

I guess previously if there was no schema it would assume that HDFS was in use whereas s3 paths always start with s3. I think this is usually the case with our on-prem setup so I'm not sure if the change you made to always check hdfs will work for those cases...

it does this test tests the two methods separately but in our code we actually always add the schema and then add the name. So we won't call it with "/" it will be hdfs:// or file:// depending on the HiveConf.
I think the code as it is now where we only add the name node if and only if we're certain that we're on hdfs makes more sense.
This test is broken I'll fix it...
mocking a Map, madness!

nodes.bodyText: A general question: is there a reason to prefer the generic assertThat to more specific methods, like assertNotNull in this case?
We prefer hamcrest. I'm ambivalent either way. This was copy paste since the code was moved I moved the test code as well.
Ditto: why not assertEquals?
Why was this changed ?

Just resetting the values after a completed replication. Once the replication is done these value are not valid anymore another replication might come in. This state should be refreshed for every replication.
I stand corrected I shouldn't have changed this all the tests started failing. I've put this back I guess it's ok that we override on start.
Should we consider this a 15.1.0 release? It's somewhere between a bug fix and a feature...
ah yes forgot to bring that up. I'm for 15.1.0 as well.
CopierFactoryFactory ;)
